value: Elevation of a Wall Panel with a Fireplace

label: Description
value: A double register of figured panels is over the center part of the medallion. Two circular medallions are in in the top register with men in profile. The bottom panel depicts a man feeding a cow.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Framework in three sections, possibly for an altar tablet

label: Description
value: The decoration of the vertical stripes refers to the sacrament of the altar. Two angels carry the Ark of the Covenant before the tops of the trees. Attributes of the old dispensation, a cork, a snake, a key are represented in the bottom framing of the central section. The tops of the central sections show angels with attributes of virture: strength, justice, prudence, temperance respectively. Two angels and a crouching lion (Vigilance) are at the bottom at left, two angels and a spead eagle at left.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and washes, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design of a Console Table with a Mirror

label: Description
value: Conceived, probably by an apprentice, in the style of François Cuvilliés. A dragon is shown in an escutcheon in the bottom center of the table, a trophy of attributes of gods in a panel over the mirror.

label: Physical description
value: Pen with greyish, black ink, brush with black washes, black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Candelabrum scheme includes a girl standing under a canopy on a sphere holds the ends of the ribbons wound around trees forming part of the lateral framing. Crouching sphinxes flank the girl. Doves, putti medallion, three-quarter figures of the satyress and a mermaid, a pilaster and a vase, as alternative motifs. A female mask is included in the design of the upper part of the composition.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and black and light blue watercolor washes on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Tapestry or a Painted Wall Hanging

label: Description
value: Eleven various wild birds scattered in setting of low trees. In lower center, feed basket from which one bird eats; upper center, two birds fight in tree. Pen and black ink border some edges.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and brown wash, watercolor on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux (acquired after 1906); 1911: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Side view; spout is at right. Body and cover have twelve corners and tapered bottom.  Sides of body are alternately decorated with a void with a genius and lozenge with a woman's head. A snake sits atop the cover. Stand formed by four angular poles.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an Urn on a Stand

label: Description
value: A side view of an urn with the spout on the left. The urn is oval in shape, with curved wooden handle at top. The stand is unadorned except by ring handles and air slits.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush with gray, black, green watercolor on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Water Kettle with Stand

label: Description
value: Kettle shown from side view; spout at left. Upper and lower parts of body surrounded with calyxes; leaf band along inner rim of the upper section. One end of asymmetrical handle is fastened to body lower than the other, ending in a snake's forepart. Stand with a receptacle for spirits.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash, graphite on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Water Kettle with Stand

label: Description
value: Kettle shown side view; spout at left; urn-shaped body. Handle is hinged to the shoulder. Bottom of body and top of cover covered in shell decor. Stand with curved legs, receptacle for spirits.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash, graphite on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an Urn on a Stand

label: Description
value: Urn in profile with the spout facing left. The spout terminates in a parrot's head. The urn's oval body is adorned with a leaf arabesque and swan in the center. A kneeling nude child as the finial. The stand supports are in the form of parrots' heads with claw feet resting on balls. The spriit lamp is contained within an urn.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Water Urn with Stand

label: Description
value: On circular plinth with four feet (three visible), a sphere, top section of which serves as cover and topped by Cupid in a chariot drawn by a snail.  Supported by curved poles with lion feet and lion heads with wings.  Spout starts from a dolphin's head which has a human face and which tops two bodies upon which two girls sit. Underneath are three blacksmiths around an anvil which would have been intended as a receptacle for spirits.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and black, gray wash on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Candelabrum composed of fantastic animals, a flower basket, cornucopiae, a sun head, surrounded by floral motifs. Drapery festoons are on top. Framed by mouldings, paper margins.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Collection of Léon Decloux. Entered Decloux's collection after 1906. Ex-coll. of Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, 1896 for 215 francs.)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an Urn on a Stand with a Spirit Lamp

label: Description
value: An urn on a circular plinth with four feet. The bottle is heart shaped with a funnel, topped by a butterfly. Two forked handles with eagle heads. The hole for the spout is surrounded by a wreath and by winged half-figures. The egg-shaped receptacle underneath the urn sits atop a tripod.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The handle formed by two snakes on the right. The spout and a ring as a supplementary handle are at left. A shell surrounds the bottom of the body, and a band with a grape vine rinceau in the top section.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash on wover paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an Urn on a Stand

label: Description
value: The spout shown in right profile. The spout terminates in a bird's head, and a fish forms the valve handle. The body of the urn is decorated with leaf clusters and the handles are formed by swans springing from acanthus rinceaux. The stand is composed of acanthus leaf panels alternating with overlapping fan-shaped motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A pedestal decorated with a palmette and on top is the receptacle for a spirit lamp. The egg-shaped body of the urn rises between two mermaids flanking the dolphin head with the hole for the spout which is lightly sketched in pencil at left. The foreparts of two swans form the handles.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink, brush and gray-brown wash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Side view with the spout at right. On a square plinth on knobs. Egg-shaped urn with cover. Two snakes form the handle.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an Apparatus for Boiling Water

label: Description
value: Front view. Ovoidal plinth. Two scrolls topped by lion heads hold the body which is shaped as a part of an egg.  The bottom section of the cover is surrounded by a kind of railing; the top section shows cut out quatrefoils.  A tripod censer on top. The spout starts from a mask. Underneath: a receptacle for spirits consisting of an egg shape and the foreparts of crouching dragons.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Silver Coffee Urn

label: Description
value: Shown from side with spout at left.  A spherical quadrangle as a base is supported by beads.  Four fluted gaines with lion feet hold the body which is shaped like part of an egg and shows a lion mask with ring. The cover topped by a knob.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash, graphite on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Urn-shaped. The spout is at left with fluid streaming from it. Smoke rises from the holes in the knob of the cover. Two pairs of entwined snakes form the two handles.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash, graphite on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Silver and Crystal Compote

label: Description
value: A crystal bowl with scalloped edges rests on three silver dolphins, which appear as if on the crest of a waterfall (probaly also intended to be executed in crystal). Silver base, with scalloped edges, resting on ball feet.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Openwork basket supported by the Three Graces on a circular base.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Animal's heads support festoons of hides. Trophies of Dionysiac objects are suspended from the heads. Medallions with Bacchic Representations hang in the intervals. Framed by mouldings.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on paper with brush and ink wash

label: Provenance
value: Collection of Léon Decloux  Ex-coll. of Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris. May 19, 1896 for 100 francs.)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Crystal Urn with Silver Mounts

label: Description
value: Ovoidal carved glass urn, with a circular base and tall neck, decorated with spiral fluting. Silver handles terminating in roosters' heads, and attached at their bases to a band of grapevine encircling the body of the object. Signed pen and black ink, lower right: J. Seethaler.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, green water color on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A vase is supported by the bottom parts of the birds. Sea sphinxes crouch upon it and support another base shaped as a capital upside down. The shape of a column with a capital is supported by pairs of human feet.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Three-Tiered Sweetmeat and Stand

label: Description
value: The stand is designed with a mixture of Empire and Romanesque styles. Some moldings are alternatively suggested with and without palmette decorations. Columns form the central acanthus rinceaux as tails. A kind of pine cone atops the stand.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black and brown ink, brush and gray wash, slight traces of graphite on cream wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Bowl with a Stand

label: Description
value: A pedestal of complicated design showing a fruit festoon, with bearded masks and plant motifs, is supported by lotus blossoms. A big and short column is surrounded by girls holding a thyrsus in either hand. The capital is shaped like a basket.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for the Silver Mount for a Glass Fruit Bowl

label: Description
value: Chimeras standing upon three columns support the base of a bowl with scalloped top edge. It is surrounded by grape vines.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
